SEARCH
Package com.app.geometry.point

Class Point

java.lang.Object
com.app.geometry.point.Point
public class Point extends Object
The Point class represents a point in a 2D Cartesian coordinate system. It provides methods for various geometric operations like cross products, vector calculations, and comparisons between points.

      public Point()

  • Method Details

    • crossProduct

      public double crossProduct(Point p)
      Computes the cross product between this point and another point. The cross product is useful in determining the relative orientation of two vectors.
      Parameters:
      p - The other point to compute the cross product with.
      Returns:
      The result of the cross product.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided point is null.

    • productVariableX

      public double productVariableX(double x)
      Multiplies the x-coordinate of this point by a given variable.
      Parameters:
      x - The variable to multiply with the x-coordinate.
      Returns:
      The result of the multiplication.

    • productVariableY

      public double productVariableY(double y)
      Multiplies the y-coordinate of this point by a given variable.
      Parameters:
      y - The variable to multiply with the y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      The result of the multiplication.

    • compareVariableX

      public boolean compareVariableX(Point p)
      Compares the x-coordinate of this point with another point's x-coordinate.
      Parameters:
      p - The other point to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if this point's x-coordinate is greater than the other point's x-coordinate, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided point is null.

    • compareVariableY

      public boolean compareVariableY(Point p)
      Compares the y-coordinate of this point with another point's y-coordinate.
      Parameters:
      p - The other point to compare with.
      Returns:
      true if this point's y-coordinate is greater than the other point's y-coordinate, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided point is null.

    • vector

      public Point vector(Point p)
      Computes the vector from this point to another point. The resulting vector is the difference between the coordinates of the two points.
      Parameters:
      p - The other point to compute the vector to.
      Returns:
      A new Point representing the vector from this point to the provided point.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided point is null.
